document.docTitle: Campsurus demeni Molineri & Salles 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of selected species of Campsurus Eaton 1868 (Ephemeroptera: Polymitarcyidae), with description of eleven new species and a key to male imagos of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of selected species of Campsurus Eaton 1868 (Ephemeroptera: Polymitarcyidae), with description of eleven new species and a key to male imagos of the genus

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material. Holotype ♂ i from BRAZIL , Amazonas , Barcelos , rio Demeni , boca do rio,
8–9.viii.2009
, S 0° 25' 29" / W 62° 54' 20" , pennsylvania light trap , N Hamada col. ( CZNC ). Paratypes : 27 ♂ i same data as holotype ( CZNC , except 5 in IBN, slide IBN775CM)
;
50 ♂ i from Amazonas , Barcelos , Serrinha , rio Aracá , N 00°24'34" / W 63°23'17" ,
29.vii.2009
, N 00°24'33,88" / W 63°23'17,16" , pennsylvania light trap , N Hamada col. ( CZNC )
;
3 ♂ i from Amazonas , Arquipélago de Anavilhanas , Manaus ,
31.vii
, 2000, N 2° 40' 20" / W 60° 46' 40" , JL Nessimian col. ( CZNC )
;
6 ♂ i from Amazonas , Barcelos , Serrinha , rio Aracá ,
29–30.vii.2009
, N 00°24'33,88" / W 63°23'17,16" , pennsylvania light trap , N Hamada col. ( CZNC ); and 6 ♂ i ( CZNC , except 2 at IBN) from Roraima , Boa Vista , Rio Cauamé , N 2° 49' 11" / W 60° 40' 24" ,
28.ii.2003
, UV light-trap, N Hamada col.
;
2 ♂ i from Acre , Mancio Lima , Parque Nacional da Serra do Divisor , rio Azul , Colocaçao Joao Eracle ,
15.iii.2006
, AR Calor col. (IBN).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 111–116.
Campsurus demeni
sp. nov.
: 111, penes and pedestal, with detail of microlepides on sternum IX, v.v. (SEM).
Campsurus lucidus
(Bolivia): 112, male mesosternum (p = mesofurcasternal plate, im = inner margin of plate, L = leg); 113, female abdominal sterna VI–IX (g = gonopore and eggs, sk = sockets, roman numbers = number of abdominal segment); 114, same, detail after KOH treatment.
Campsurus sinamari
sp. nov.
(KOH treated): 115, sternum VIII; 116, detail of sockets. Arrows indicate socket´s openings.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific epithet is a noun in apposition. The species is named in allusion to the type locality, Rio Demeni , the southern limit of Yanomami´s territories.
Distribution ( Fig. 180 ). Brazil ( Amazonas , Roraima , Acre ).
Discussion. See discussion under previous species. The numerous small spines covering the penes near the outer margins are unique to this species.
